urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text:
Do you live in an area at risk of flooding?‚òîÔ∏è

You don't have to be next to a river or the sea. Flooding can come from different sources so be #FloodAware by checking your risk at https://t.co/TfMNGBSfGK

Follow @LDN_Environment & @envagencySE 

#FloodActionWeek #LDNFloodAware https://t.co/3A4cS4Y0FX

urls.title: LDN Flood Awareness Week
urls.description: Find out if you could be affected by flooding and what you can do to prepare.

tweets.text:
Would you know what to do in a flood? This week is London Flood Awareness Week. We'll be sharing info on
types of flood risk and what you can do to be more prepared. #LDNFloodAware https://t.co/H0ZAfIHTa2 https://t.co/HoeHfnldIE

Do you know what to do if you receive a flood warning? 

Know your warning codes! ‚ö†Ô∏è

Find out more https://t.co/wwueotBnkz

#PrepareActSurvive #Floodaware https://t.co/Vk2OtrTGXG

It's Flood Action Week!!! 
Would you know how to protect yourself and your possessions during a flood? Find out what you can do to prepare https://t.co/llOVfTSi2C
#PrepareActSurvive @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/1164f9g322

Today is the start of #FloodActionWeek!

Over the next 7 days, make it your aim to know what to do in a flood to keep yourself and the things you love safe.

Take the first step and visit üëâhttps://t.co/CFSTzxnzju

#PrepareActSurvive #FloodActionWeek https://t.co/4PO64ouIJz

urls.title: How to plan ahead for flooding - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
With the Autumn-Winter season now in full swing, it's important to know what to do in the event of a flood. 

It's #FloodActionWeek and all this week we're raising awareness on what to do

There's more from the @EnvAgency available here 
https://t.co/mkibIttgSy https://t.co/NA442f5P9R

Free courses available for anyone in the Lowestoft area interested in helping local people in emergency situations. See here for more information:
https://t.co/DrmrccvJ0K
https://t.co/cPOQdioLAR
https://t.co/TjZfqwjhnv

@CommunitiesPrep @EnvAgencyAnglia @EastSuffolk #CPLowestoft https://t.co/H2IHAmxTit

Tussocks! These soil forming structures in #culmgrassland disrupt surface flow pathways, storing and delaying water which would otherwise wash into rivers @DevonWildlife @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/t6LItdPvRc

As hosts of #COP26, we're committed to protecting and restoring our natural environment.

We're working #TogetherForOurPlanet with @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm and others to deliver the Nature Recovery Network and create better connected spaces for nature üåø https://t.co/e6wIperqa2
We‚Äôre pleased to support the @EnvAgency‚Äôs #FloodActionWeek, promoting the steps we can all take to reduce the risk of flooding https://t.co/NceTv0dYAN

Saturday mass slurry polluting on the @MendipHillsAONB today üåß soil run off ....slurry in the moat @Bishops_Palace Tues slurry in the Sheppy then @AvalonMarshes then Burnham this has to stop @suesustainable @SWTsteve @StephenMoss_TV @BenGoldsmith @EnvAgencySW @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/if0JfI6YMX

Talking with @BBC_Cumbria shortly about @EnvAgencyNW Flood Action Campaign.  I know we are all busy but please take a moment to check your flood risk and #BePrepared 

https://t.co/XlGk8Mhjnv

tweets.text: Fairford Sewage Works deals a crippling blow to the Cotswolds limestone River Coln yesterday. No evidence of pollution or decline says the @EnvAgency as it dies before our eyes @KenGoodwinITV https://t.co/Bs7fI3JISi

Publication of a report we produced for the @EnvAgency to help deliver on the AMR Action Plan 

"Framework for understanding environmental antimicrobial resistance in England" https://t.co/iguV2HJtng https://t.co/Iz9MleX0Nx

Hard to think that this discharge from the Barney Craig mine pollutes 40km of river down the Tyne with toxic metals. Plans by @CoalAuthority & @EnvAgency to be  innovative and treat this. https://t.co/kUZJyyMYB9

We have been working with @N_Rivers_Trust on a design for a fish pass on Becketswell Bridge.

Works will start on site in the coming months. This work has been part funded by our Water Environment Improvement Fundüëç #Norfolk #Fish https://t.co/e13mTeNf2x

The Salmon are back in Swindale! My keen helpers and I saw at least 8 swimming around in our rewiggled section today üòÅ

- Lee

urls.title: Guest blog - 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting, by Miles King - Mark Avery
urls.description: Miles King has written regularly on this site. His previous blogs and more information about him can be found here. Twitter: @MilesKing10 Berrier Farm under Trees: 100 acres of Bog, Heath and Grassland destroyed by tree-planting. England desperately needs more trees, we are constantly told. And it‚Äôs certainly true that tree cover here is lower than most other European countries. The data must be handled with care though, when tree cover can include anything from Eucalyptus plantations in Spain, to Sitka

tweets.text: @BigWatchLover @KentPolice18900 @EnvAgencySE @kentruralpolice https://t.co/S17XKO8fzY

@KentPolice18900 @EnvAgencySE @kentruralpolice That‚Äôs not two metres. Measure it on the car. A six-foot tall person could not lay in that gap. More importantly, what‚Äôs the tweet about? No good just talking about social distancing. What are you and the man in brown actually doing? What‚Äôs Traverse?

Late shift patrols of The Upper River Thurne visiting @marthamboats @NorfolkWT @HorseyNT @HicklingWSC on
#RemembranceDay 
Paul @NorfolkPolice
